newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Formulab says NASDAQ listing delayed.
newsitem.headline: Formulab says NASDAQ listing delayed.

text.p: Computer group Formulab Neuronetics Corp Ltd said on Friday it has not yet compeleted its capital raising and proposed listing on NASDAQ.
Formulab said the company and its advisers had been working to a series of deadlines in Australia and the U.S., particularly the requirement to finalise the offering by April 4.

It said those deadlines could no longer be met, but that it was continuing to work with its U.S. investment banking adviser with the aim of successfully concluding the capital raising and listing as soon as possible. Formulab has been seeking a NASDAQ listing since August 1996.
Formulab requested a share suspension on Wednesday.
The company launched its neural PC, the Richter Paradigm Computer, in the U.S. in December 1996. The computer was said to be able to process more complex problems than existing personal computers.
Formulab's share price tumbled shortly after the U.S. launch on media reports of a negative reaction to the launch. The shares hit a peak around A$1.52 in December last year.
At 1.55 p.m. (0355 GMT), Formulab shares were 12.5 cents lower at 25 cents.
